Note: This is a larger dataset on Bai dialects, a minority language spoken in China (Yunnan province), which was digitized and linked to Concepticon as part of the Chinese Dialect Database project.
Author: Allen, Brian

Note: This database of Bantu languages is included as part of the Austronesian Basic Vocabulary Database but was created by a different team of experts.
Author: Teil-Dautrey, Gisèle

Note: This is a large collection of Chinese dialect data, which was created in the 1950s and digitized as part of the Chinese Dialect Database project.
Author: {Beijing University}

Note: The data stems from a study of the phylogeny and the age of Pama-Nyungan languages, by Bowern and Atkinson (2012).
Author: Bowern, Claire

Note: This large dataset of Columbian languages by Huber and Reed (1992) was digitized as part of the Quantitative Historical Linguistics project.
Author: Huber, Randall Q. and Reed, Robert B.

Note: The Intercontinental Dictionary Series offers standardized word lists for a large variety of different languages.
Author: Key, Mary Ritchie and Comrie, Bernard

Note: This is a compilation of wordlists for more than 60 Chadic languages.
Author: Kraft, C. H.

Note: The NorthEuralex project offers a large collection of word lists for more than 1000 North Eurasian languages.
Author: Dellert, Johannes and Jäger, Gerhard

Note: The authors provide 13 wordlists based on a larger questionnaire for Timor-Alor-Pantar languages.
Author: Robinson, Laura C and Holton, Gary

Note: The Tanzania Language Survey was compiled during the early seventies and partially published in several publications. Recent efforts by the CBOLD project try to provide the data in digital form.
Author: Nurse, Derek and Phillipson, Gérard
Tryon, Darrel T. and Hackman, Brian D.
